title: Phosphorus can cause algal blooms in lakes

content.question: In August of 2014, residents of several Ohio cities that use Lake Erie as a drinking water source were warned not to drink tap water because of the presence of toxins released by blue-green algae (cyanobacteria). Which of the following is the most likely cause of recent blooms of blue-green algae in Lake Erie?

choices.label: Increased recreational use of Lake Erie
Carbon in wastewater from fracking operations
Chlorine from sewage treatment plants along Lake Erieâ€™s shoreline
